g.title: over_reliance_chain_C1
g.text: Shows how natural-language explanations speed users but trigger over-reliance, hurting accuracy, and how tested interface changes mitigate the problem.
Reading model-generated natural language explanations is faster than scanning retrieved passages.

g.title: over_reliance_chain_C2
g.text: When explanations are wrong, users still trust them.

g.title: retrieval_recall_chain_C5
g.text: Illustrates how evidence recall controls explanation accuracy and downstream human performance, motivating better retrievers.
High retrieval recall boosts explanation accuracy
Explanations reach 80 % accuracy when all evidence retrieved vs 68 % when not.

g.title: over_reliance_chain_C3
g.text: Over-reliance drives human accuracy to 35 %, worse than no aid.

g.title: over_reliance_chain_I2
g.text: Show both supporting and refuting GPT-3.5 arguments.

g.title: over_reliance_chain_I1
g.text: Provide top-k Wikipedia evidence instead of explanations.

g.title: retrieval_recall_chain_C6
g.text: Low retrieval recall harms human accuracy
Across interfaces, missing evidence lowers users’ verification accuracy.

g.title: no_complementary_benefit_chain_C9
g.text: Combining explanations with retrieval offers no added benefit and increases time cost.
No benefit from combining retrieval and explanation
Accuracy same as retrieval alone but decisions slower.

g.title: retrieval_recall_chain_I4
g.text: Upgrade or fine-tune retriever before generating explanations.
